data.lyric:
[ti:Africa]
[ar:Weezer]
[al:Africa]
[by:]
[offset:0]
[00:00.00]Africa - Weezer (威瑟乐队)
[00:14.13]I hear the drums echoing tonight
[00:16.87]
[00:17.65]But she hears only whispers of some quiet conversation
[00:23.32]
[00:25.89]She's coming in 12:30 flight
[00:28.56]
[00:29.52]The moonlit wings reflect the stars that guide me towards salvation
[00:35.19]
[00:37.60]I stopped an old man along the way
[00:40.57]
[00:41.30]Hoping to find some old forgotten words or ancient melodies
[00:46.68]
[00:49.21]He turned to me as if to say
[00:52.07]
[00:52.85]Hurry boy it's waiting there for you
[00:56.32]
[00:59.69]It's gonna take a lot to drag me away from you
[01:04.27]
[01:04.99]There's nothing that a hundred men or more could ever do
[01:09.24]
[01:10.12]I bless the rains down in Africa
[01:14.40]
[01:15.45]Gonna take some time to do the things we never have
[01:20.91]
[01:33.53]The wild dogs cry out in the night
[01:36.04]
[01:37.04]As they grow restless longing for some solitary company
[01:42.51]
[01:45.32]I know that I must do what's right
[01:48.26]As sure as Kilimanjaro rises like Olympus above the Serengeti
[01:54.66]
[01:57.26]I seek to cure what's deep inside
[02:00.03]
[02:00.69]Frightened of this thing that I've become
[02:04.92]
[02:07.67]It's gonna take a lot to drag me away from you
[02:12.20]
[02:12.90]There's nothing that a hundred men or more could ever do
[02:17.06]
[02:17.99]I bless the rains down in Africa
[02:22.11]
[02:23.24]Gonna take some time to do the things we never have
[02:30.27]
[02:56.82]Hurry boy she's waiting there for you
[03:00.59]
[03:03.52]It's gonna take a lot to drag me away from you
[03:08.11]
[03:08.79]There's nothing that a hundred men or more could ever do
[03:12.79]
[03:13.83]I bless the rains down in Africa
[03:18.17]
[03:19.00]I bless the rains down in Africa
[03:23.22]
[03:24.19]I bless the rains down in Africa
[03:28.35]
[03:29.27]I bless the rains down in Africa
[03:33.57]
[03:34.38]I bless the rains down in Africa
[03:38.53]
[03:39.62]Gonna take some time to do the things we never have
